docs.title: Welcome
docs.text: This is my personal website where I share my projects, writings, and puzzles. Feel free to explore and reach out if you have any questions or comments!

docs.title: Calculator
docs.text:
In [ ]: Copied! 
import ipywidgets as widgets
from IPython.display import display

a = widgets.IntText(value=0, description='A:')
b = widgets.IntText(value=0, description='B:')
out = widgets.Output()

def compute(change):
    with out:
        out.clear_output()
        print(f"Sum: {a.value + b.value}")

a.observe(compute, names='value')
b.observe(compute, names='value')

display(a, b, out)
import ipywidgets as widgets from IPython.display import display a = widgets.IntText(value=0, description='A:') b = widgets.IntText(value=0, description='B:') out = widgets.Output() def compute(change): with out: out.clear_output() print(f"Sum: {a.value + b.value}") a.observe(compute, names='value') b.observe(compute, names='value') display(a, b, out)

docs.title: Project Euler
docs.text:
Project Euler is a collection of challenging mathematical/computer programming problems that require more than just mathematical insights to solve. A large part of the appeal of Project Euler is that the problems can often be solved with clever algorithms and efficient coding techniques.

These are the problems I have solved from Project Euler.

docs.title: How to?
docs.text:
This is a first puzzle.

\[ \int_0^1 x^2 \, dx \]
